value.title: DAX Fridays! #172: LEFT, RIGHT, LEN, SEARCH - Split text by character in DAX
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to split text by a character using DAX and why this search error happens and how to solve it: The search Text provided to function 'SEARCH' could not be found in the given text.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE

value.title: DAX Fridays! #2: CALENDAR, CALENDARAUTO
value.excerpt: Create a calendar with DAX in Power BI. Generate/ Create calendars in DAX using CALENDAR() and/or CALENDARAUTO().  Video keynotes: 01:02 Calendarauto function 03:02 Calendar function  Link to Power BI file and Curbal Glossary: https://curbal.com/blog/create-power-bi-custom-calendars  PREVIOUS VIDEO:

value.title: DAX Fridays #201: How to create virtual tables using DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sONvctPlplY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot.  We will calculate running totals with a Date and with another column (not a date).  Link to Matt's Blog post: http://exceleratorbi.com.au/cumulative-running-total-based-on-highest-value/  Link to

value.title: DAX Fridays! #25: Wrong Grand Totals in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through why sometimes Power BI grand totals dont add up and what to do to fix it. value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.   For example, if you want to calculate the sum of sales between two specific dates, this is the perfect function for you.  You can "hardcode" the

value.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt
